text.text_translated:
Your boss stops you. She wants to talk about your work. It is about the last project. She wants to talk about your performance. You feel bad all weekend. You worry about the project. You think: "Did I do something wrong?"
On Monday, you go to her office. She says good things about your work first. You think: "Is this the good talk she has to say first?" You think: "Is she going to say her real message next?" This way of talking is like a sandwich. First, people say good things. Then, they say what they really think. Then, they say good things again.
